title: The sent emails are nowhere
creator: vojtech.rehak
content:
I am a novice in Thunderbird on Android (version 8.2). I have uploaded my settings from my desktop, where there is 

       <value key="sentFolderSelection">AUTOMATIC</value>        <value key="subscribedFoldersOnly">false</value>        <value key="syncRemoteDeletions">true</value>        <value key="uploadSentMessages">true</value>

So, I expect that the emails I send will be stored in the folder where there is the message I reply to.

But unfortunately, they are not there. I tried to find them in Sent, Archive... but did not succeed anywhere.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/133.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Android

title: Shared Outlook Mailboxes
creator: mozilla697
content: I've been trying to add Shared Outlook Office 365 Mailboxes to Thunderbird Mobile, but using the recommended method that is used on other email apps using a backslash "myaccount@example.com\sharedmailbox@example.com" doesn't seem to work in Thunderbird. Is there a different method that I am missing?

title: New folder
creator: bobbrown65a
content: How do I make a new folder

title: Changing the From: address.
creator: junk3000-temp
content:
Change request. Hi, With Thunderbird for Windows I can free-type a From: address that is different from the account email address, and I would like to do this on the Android version too. For the avoidance of doubt, I don't want to use another account's email address, I want to free-type whatever I choose.

For example Yahoo allows me to create up to 500 email aliases in the form alias-anyword@yahoo.com

As this feature has always been available on the desktop version, is it something you could incorporate on Android?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/133.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36;os:Android 9

title: Android Thunderbird Account Option Meaning
creator: MikeA01730
content:
Hi,

In Settings for an IMAP account, Fetching mail, there's an option "Erase deleted messages on server" that has 3 options: Immediately, When polling, and Manually. I get the first 2, but what happens when I select Manually?

Thanks, Mike
